body_html:
What I was telling to Andrew previously is that the op generator is going to be written in C++ and will have its own templating engine but it would be great to share the same techonology since the final goals are pretty similar, I don't know Asim if you have any good suggestion for this too...

Also, about copying the generated files into source trees, current solution for the op generator is to generate those files into an external source jar (.srcjar) that will be included into the library build rule.

What I was telling to Andrew previously is that the op generator is going to be written in C++ and will have its own templating engine but it would be great to share the same techonology since the final goals are pretty similar, I don't know Asim if you have any good suggestion for this too...
Also, about copying the generated files into source trees, current solution for the op generator is to generate those files into an external source jar (.srcjar) that will be included into the library build rule.
body:
What I was telling to Andrew previously is that the op generator is going to be written in C++ and will have its own templating engine but it would be great to share the same techonology since the final goals are pretty similar, I don't know Asim if you have any good suggestion for this too... 

Also, about copying the generated files into source trees, current solution for the op generator is to generate those files into an external source jar (.srcjar) that will be included into the library build rule.
